reviews.review_msg: Everyone here is actually right. With TAs to keep him straight he was amazing, alone he was befuddled. I think if he had just chucked the syllabus we wouldn't have worried about it and people could've had a better time. At the end of the day, he made Med. Studies interesting to a modernist like me and that's amazing. Totally owned his material.

Charismatic, passionate, and interesting. However. He spends much of class going off on tangents that do NOT help one understand these difficult texts. His lectures lack context, structure, and, sometimes, clarity. If he tried harder at these things rather than just getting worked up about stuff he would be a fabulous teacher.

I really, really enjoyed James Acken. Wildly passionate and very knowledgeable; however, he enjoys expelling information more than dealing with bureaucratic issues (marking, etc.) and if you do need that structure I wouldn't recommend him. If you're interested in Norse/Celtic lit and lore you won't find a better prof on campus. And yes, he's hot :)

James is amazing.  I've never met someone who is so passionate about thier teaching, and subject area.  He has so much energy; no class is ever boring, and he give you so much information.  He is also one of the most approachable and helpful profs.  His door is always open.  He is also ohhh so hot!!!
I LOVE this guys. I've never seen a professor so passionate about his subject matter and I've never been able to be engaged throughout an entire four hour lecture. Awesome.

Best English prof! Passionate about what he does and makes every lecture engaging. Accessible and supportive, and really helps improve students' writing skills. Would recommend courses with him; it doesn't matter what it is, you'll be engaged and learn a lot. Good attitude and easy to talk to, David is by far one of the best profs of any department

Coley is such an amazing prof. He makes medieval lit come to life and has an incredible way of making a 2 hour lecture feel like 30mins. His class is always interesting and invigorating. He's a very fair marker and really cares for his students and their work. Take a course with him. You won't regret it.
Three words: BEST PROF EVER. Go take a class with him stat.

Makes archaic dry material comes to life. Always attentive, cares for students. Listens and responds to comments, not just make-work. Requires that you care in return. Maybe too much seminar, not enough lecture. Pushes discussion a bit far at times. Still, personnable and in control (shows careful prep, mindful of time constraints). Recommended!
Can't say enough good about him. He radiates with the joy he experiences working with Medieval literature. I rarely have instructors as hands-on and involved with his students too. Amazing prof.
Awesome guy, passionate prof.  Very interesting lectures had no interest in M.Lit before taking his class.  Very approachable and helpful with assignments.  Cares about his students and it shows.
David is a great prof. This is my 2nd course with him. I took 201 with him before and I actually enjoy Medieval lit b/c of him. He's very passionate about what he teaches and very helpful.

Nilsson is an engaging professor who used video clips from Monty Python (among others) to compare to the texts read in class. He encouraged variation in course assignments rather than just writing an essay/response essay. This class was mostly seminary and as long as you were paying attention it was pretty easy.
Best. Prof. Ever. Genuinely super kind, always wants to help, and he's hilarious. He is so, so good and teaching and such a nice person. If you ever have the chance to take class with him, do it!

Professor Hussey was great! He gave excellent feedback (a paragraph response) to every paper & was clear on what was expected for each assignment. I would definitely recommend going to his office hours as he helps you narrow down your thesis (he likes specific) & gives extra insight on the topic and readings at hand.

My second time with Matt, and again, the course was just amazing. Intensely knowledgable prof who will make you love, or at least respect Medieval lit.  Course can be intense, but he makes up for it by being hilarious.  If you want to become a better English student, or just enjoy an awesome course, take one with Matt!

Old English spoken as a rap -- a great sense of humour, easy on the eyes: this prof is one for your "must try" list! He expects you to work for your grade, and he's not a pushover, but he's reasonable and very encouraging.
